title: How to get the first order of freelancing work as a web designer - Quora

response.answer_text: Freelancing is the best way for people to get independence and work from wherever they want, but this lifestyle is also about taking the risk of leaving a full-time job with a stable salary. The beginning is always tough, it’s a long journey that needs consistency and patience, so be ready for getting rejected and for bad clients who are going to make you hate your job. Please be ready for that! Now move on to the first order: Build an online portfolio: This is your capital! Build an appealing portfolio website, get yourself a professional photo and put on the home page, and then list the projects you have worked on. Give a brief to each study case by following the Design Thinking methodology, your potential clients will be amazed and will know that you master your work and you will be able to understand their needs. Remember, Web Design is about solving problems.Work for free: If you are a beginner, and you don’t have any experience, it’s okay to work for free, you can go to a shop or a primary school nearby and ask them to build a website for them for free, they will be more than happy. And yes, now you have a case study to add to your portfolio website.Promote yourself: Word of mouth is still so powerful in an era of technology, so don’t underestimate it and make sure that your environment knows about your services.Optimize your portfolio website: Make sure to use keywords on your portfolio website, there are different tools to find the right keywords, choose a good domain name, and List your website on business listings websites. The Best tip ever!Networking: God, I have been to many hackathons during my college, and I have seen people getting dreamy offers just by networking, GO TOWARD PEOPLE, don’t be shy, introduce yourself and your services. A No will never hurt someone.Use LinkedIn: I have seen a lot of freelancers ignoring this network. Again, optimize your profile, engage with others' posts, and publish from time to time content related to your field.Answer questions on Quora: Let people get some from your knowledge, you might get orders :)Well, I think I’m done, I wish you a piece of very good luck on your freelancing journey!
